headline: Palantir And Cognizant Partnership Deepens AI Role In Regulated Industries
summary: Palantir Technologies (NasdaqGS:PLTR) announced a partnership with Cognizant to expand AI driven modernization across healthcare and enterprise operations. The collaboration is focused on deploying Palantir's AI platform into complex, highly regulated sectors using Cognizant's global IT services reach. The agreement is positioned to support digital transformation projects at scale in healthcare and other data intensive industries. For you as an investor, this move highlights how Palantir is...

headline: Innodata Palantir AI Data Deal Meets Rich Valuation And Volatile Shares
summary: Innodata (NasdaqGM:INOD) announced a partnership with Palantir to supply training data and data engineering services for Palantir's AI enabled platforms supporting rideo event analysis. The collaboration focuses on complex, multimodal data and computer vision uses such as automated performance metrics in professional riding sports. The company will work within Palantir's development workflows to help customers operationalize AI in high stakes, real world settings. Innodata enters this...

headline: The Stock Market Just Got Shaky. Where to Find Solid Ground.
summary: Boring is back.  In recent days, software stocks and other risky assets have been mowed down by artificial intelligence, but stodgier stocks are springing up to replace them among the market’s leaders.  Many investors are hoping to sidestep the Grim Reaper of AI, reduce their exposure to the biggest technology stocks and still earn decent returns by beefing up their positions in these boring companies.

content.title: The Stock Market Just Got Shaky. Where to Find Solid Ground.
content.summary: Boring is back.  In recent days, software stocks and other risky assets have been mowed down by artificial intelligence, but stodgier stocks are springing up to replace them among the market’s leaders.  Many investors are hoping to sidestep the Grim Reaper of AI, reduce their exposure to the biggest technology stocks and still earn decent returns by beefing up their positions in these boring companies.

headline: Palantir CEO Takes Shots At Circular AI Investments
summary: As AI-connected company valuations continue to inflate, Palantir Technologies, Inc. (NASDAQ:PLTR) CEO Alex Karp positioned his company as the sober adult in the room. During Palantir's earnings call on Monday, Karp took direct aim at the industry trend of circular AI investments—a practice where tech giants invest in startups so those startups can spend that capital back on the investor's own cloud services or hardware. Critique of Round-Tripping Karp's rhetoric centered on the integrity of reve

headline: Nvidia Shares Surge on Big Tech’s $650 Billion AI-Spending Plan
summary: Shares of the chipmaker rose as much as 7.7%, the biggest intraday jump since April 9, adding more than $300 billion in market value.  Amazon.com Inc. sparked the rebound after the technology giant said during an earnings call that it plans to spend $200 billion on data centers, chips and other equipment this year.  All told, Amazon, along with Alphabet Inc., Meta Platforms Inc. and Microsoft Corp., are expected to shell out roughly $650 billion for AI tools in 2026, about 60% more than the prior year.

content.title: Nvidia Shares Surge on Big Tech’s $650 Billion AI-Spending Plan
content.summary: Shares of the chipmaker rose as much as 7.7%, the biggest intraday jump since April 9, adding more than $300 billion in market value.  Amazon.com Inc. sparked the rebound after the technology giant said during an earnings call that it plans to spend $200 billion on data centers, chips and other equipment this year.  All told, Amazon, along with Alphabet Inc., Meta Platforms Inc. and Microsoft Corp., are expected to shell out roughly $650 billion for AI tools in 2026, about 60% more than the prior year.

headline: Palmer Luckey-backed Erebor receives US national banking charter, WSJ reports
summary: Crypto-focused Erebor Bank became the first bank to receive a national bank charter during ​the second term of the Trump administration, the ‌Wall Street Journal reported on Friday.  The approval allows the Palmer Luckey-backed entity ‌to operate as a bank nationwide, and occurred less than eight months after it applied for a charter with the Office of the Comptroller of the Currency.  Launched by Anduril co-founder Luckey, Erebor received conditional approval from U.S. banking ‍regulators in October.

content.title: Palmer Luckey-backed Erebor receives US national banking charter, WSJ reports
content.summary: Crypto-focused Erebor Bank became the first bank to receive a national bank charter during ​the second term of the Trump administration, the ‌Wall Street Journal reported on Friday.  The approval allows the Palmer Luckey-backed entity ‌to operate as a bank nationwide, and occurred less than eight months after it applied for a charter with the Office of the Comptroller of the Currency.  Launched by Anduril co-founder Luckey, Erebor received conditional approval from U.S. banking ‍regulators in October.
